metadata.title: CVE-2023-23597 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A compromised web child process could disable web security openingrestrictions, leading to a new child process being spawned within thefile:// context. Given a reliable exploit primitive, this newprocess could be exploited again leading to arbitrary file read. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 109.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
